intro: Adenocalymma adenophorum, commonly known as the slender leaf adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Adenocalymma adenophorum is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
